info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 30 at 9:31PM CDT until April 05 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in St Louis MO has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Illinois... Kaskaskia River at Vandalia. River forecasts are based on observed precipitation and forecast precipitation for the next 48 hours. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO EARLY TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Kaskaskia River at Vandalia. * WHEN...From late tonight to early Tuesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 25.5 feet, South 4th Street begins flooding near and south of Jefferson Street in Vandalia. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 PM CDT Wednesday the stage was 15.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight to a crest of 25.0 feet Friday evening. It will then fall below flood stage Monday morning. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Sun Mon Kaskaskia River Vandalia 18.0 15.9 Wed 9 pm 23.6 25.0 24.6 20.5 17.2 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. This product, along with additional weather and stream information, is available at https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=lsx.
